Description: A cup of pale cream-grey marlware pottery, with a flattened base and almost straight sides, which rise vertically to a plain rim. There is a slight groove around the exterior at the base of the sides. This appears to be the result of manufacturing the base as a separate piece which was then attached, the groove marking the join. Viewed from above, the diameter can be seen to be slightly irregular.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52, south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 52 is scratched into the side of the vessel.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.93, fig.11, p.103, p.104, p.133, p.192, pl.34, p.216, pl.58)
